summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the SDNY discussing an upcoming trial for Carl Andrews's severed case and a defense attorney's argument that their client, Justin Rivera, is receiving less discovery access at MCC than Ghislaine Maxwell is receiving at MDC. The email requests a discussion about Maxwell's access before a court appearance.

persons.name: Carl Andrews
persons.context: The severed half of his case is scheduled for trial in mid-February 2021.

persons.name: Justin Rivera
persons.context: A defendant in the upcoming trial related to Carl Andrews's case; his lawyers argue he receives insufficient discovery access at MCC compared to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: An inmate at MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center) who is receiving discovery access that is being compared to Justin Rivera's access at MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center).

persons.name: PAE
persons.context: The judge before whom the prosecutors are scheduled to appear; likely an abbreviation for a specific judge's initials.

connections.description: Their respective access to discovery materials while in pre-trial detention is being compared by Rivera's defense attorneys, who argue Maxwell has superior access.
Rivera is a defendant in the severed half of Carl Andrews's case, indicating they were part of the same broader legal proceeding.

events.title: Scheduled trial for Carl Andrews severed case
events.description: The severed half of Carl Andrews's case is scheduled for trial in mid-February 2021.

events.title: Upcoming court appearance before PAE
events.description: The prosecutors have a scheduled appearance before Judge PAE at 10:30am to discuss matters, including Ghislaine Maxwell's access to discovery.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Defense attorneys for Justin Rivera argue he receives insufficient access to discovery at MCC compared to the access Ghislaine Maxwell receives at MDC.
The email highlights institutional differences between MDC and MCC, noting MDC is larger with more space, and specifically mentions the women's unit at MDC as spacious with its own library.
The severed half of Carl Andrews's case is scheduled for trial in mid-February 2021.
The correspondence is between federal prosecutors in the SDNY, discussing pre-trial logistics and comparative conditions of confinement for different defendants.
